Issues.Title: Visual Studio 2022 Winform designer generates code for DataGridView.AutoGenerate = false is incorrect
Issues.Body:
### Environment

Microsoft Visual Studio Enterprise 2022 (64-bit) - Current

Project type: Winform .net core 8.0


### .NET version

Winform .net core 8.0 but i belive .Net 9.0 has the same the issuse

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

yes.

### Issue description

In Winform Designer, when adding a new DataGridView control, then setting the property ‘DataGridView.AutoGenerate’ becomes ‘false’, the code generated is incorrect:
Instead of generating ‘dataGridView1.AutoGenerate = false’ into the ‘InitializeComponent()’
it declares a new local variant ‘DataGridView1 dataGridView1;’ the adding new variant ‘dataGridView1’ is the same name as the field ‘dataGridView1’ added by the designer before, thus field ‘dataGridView1’ is never initialized => at runtime throw a Null Ex.

I have recorded my screen below the file attachment (I recorded on another computer, but the other VS version (the newest) still met the same issue).

### Steps to reproduce

in VS designer
- Add a datagridview in form.
- Change the property ``GenerateMember` of datagridview  from `true` to `false`
- Check the code generated for the datagridview in method InitializeComponent()

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3b92bfd3-95c1-4f08-9ad0-fbd3bd400956

### Diagnostics

```text

```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Visual Studio 2022 Winform designer generates code for DataGridView.AutoGenerate = false is incorrect" (#13009)

Issues.Title: The text is not correct in the default added Items Collection Editor dialog for MenuStrip control in the DemoConsole application
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

main branch of WinForms repo

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

The MenuStrip controls start support from .NET SDK 10.0 Preview2

### Issue description

The text is not correct in the Items Collection Editor dialog for MenuStrip control in the DemoConsole application 
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/53c6c794-7eb1-47f5-9899-fef3dbfecc96)

### Steps to reproduce

Test sample: [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) bases on main branch in Winforms repo.

Issues.Title: Fix 12867 Add cell status to DataGridViewTextBoxCell tooltip
Issues.Body: Fixes #12867 ## Proposed changes - Add cell status to DataGridViewTextBoxCell tooltip - Corrected spelling of word `...CellTollTip` ## Customer Impact - When a DataGridViewTextBoxCell is read-only, the status can be announced by screen reader ## Regression? - No ## Risk - Minimal ## Screenshots ### Before Pressing an arrow key to move to a different DataGridViewTextBoxCell, using either NVDA or Narrator, the cell status cannot be announced ### After The cell status can be announced by the screen reader ## Test methodology - Manually ## Test environment(s) - 10.0.0-preview.2.25112.7 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/12993)

Issues.Title: [DarkMode]The Form1 title bar change to white color after change the ShowInTaskbar property
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 10.0.100-preview.2.25118.3

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No, also repro in .NET 9.0 which it started to be supported.

### Issue description

The Form1 title bar change to white color after change the ShowInTaskbar property.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/bebc2331-2ac2-435d-9552-43ab8b965be6)

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a winforms .NET Core project with a button control.
2. Enable DarkMode by Application.SetColorMode(SystemColorMode.Dark) in Program.cs file.
3. Double click button control and add below code to button click event.
`this.ShowInTaskbar = true;`
4. Build and run.
5. Click button control.

More Info:
1. This issue also repro in FormShowinTaskbar test in WinformsControlTest app.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/92e54b94-a73b-4524-bec7-cfaef740d089
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[DarkMode]The Form1 title bar change to white color after change the ShowInTaskbar property" (#12992)

Issues.Title: [Dark Mode] The Form title bar is white color when the MDIParent1 MainMenuStrip property is set to none
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 10.0.100-preview.2.25118.3

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No, also repro in .NET 9.0 which it started to be supported.

The Form title bar is white color when the MDIParent1 MainMenuStrip property is set to none.

Issues.Title: Add switch "NotifyUIAProviderTheText" to control screen Reader to announce the content of RichTextBox
Issues.Body: Fixes #12772 ## Proposed changes - Add switch `System.Windows.Forms.RichTextBox.NotifyUIAProviderTheText` to control screen Reader to announce the content of RichTextBox ## Customer Impact - RichTextBox sends the currently focused line instead of its entire contents as an accessibility event on focus. ## Regression? - Yes ## Risk - Minimal ## Screenshots ### Before When NVDA get focus, the entire content gets read, not just the currently focused line ### After When the switch is on, Narrator, JAWS and NVDA will read the full contents of the RichTextBox. When the switch is off, JAWS and NVDA will only read the contents of the currently focused line, while Narrator will not read the contents of the RichTextBox. ## Test methodology - Manually ## Test environment(s) - .net 10.0.0-preview.2.25112.7 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/12986)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add switch "NotifyUIAProviderTheText" to control screen Reader to announce the content of RichTextBox" (#12986)

Issues.Title: The SplitContainer control smarttag item “Horizontal Splitter Orientation" has an extra '.' in DemoConsole application
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

main branch of WinForms repo

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No, also repro in release/8.0 branch

### Issue description

Actual result: The SplitContainer control smarttag item “Horizontal Splitter Orientation" has an extra '.'.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/640516c8-d58f-45f2-9108-c477d014bd3f)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/abb3e7e6-a668-43fb-9b45-84d260d5c80d)

Expected result: The SplitContainer control smarttag item “Horizontal Splitter Orientation" should not contain '.'.

Issues.Title: Exception pops up when moving the mouse wheel up or down in ShortcutKeys property
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 10 SDK build: 10.0.100-preview.2.25118.3

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, cannot repro in .NET 6.0/7.0, regression from .NET 8.0

### Issue description

Exception pops up when moving the mouse wheel up or down in ShortcutKeys property. Repro in .NET 10/9/8, cannot in .NET6/7

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eaf6277b-5208-489b-a100-b6682c07fe42)

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0631f645-38ce-4e0e-bc73-519442952210

**Debug log:**
System.ComponentModel.InvalidEnumArgumentException
  HResult=0x80070057
  Message=The value of argument 'value' (65536) is invalid for Enum type 'Keys'. (Parameter 'value')
  Source=System.Windows.Forms
  StackTrace:
   at System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripMenuItem.set_ShortcutKeys(Keys value) in C:\Users\v-olzhan\source\repos\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms\src\System\Windows\Forms\Controls\ToolStrips\ToolStripMenuItem.cs:line 365
   at System.Reflection.MethodBaseInvoker.InvokeWithOneArg(Object obj, BindingFlags invokeAttr, Binder binder, Object[] parameters, CultureInfo culture)

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a Winforms .NET application with menuStrip and propertyGrid controls added
2. Add a toolStripMenuItem1 in menuStrip
3. Set propertyGrid's SelectedObject to toolStripMenuItem1
4. Build and run application
5. Find ShortcutKeys property in propertyGrid, click `(None)` value, then move the mouse wheel up or down
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Exception pops up when moving the mouse wheel up or down in ShortcutKeys property" (#12982)
